summary: A small mod with seven different night-eye effects. Compatible with Night Eye Overhaul, Predator Vision and Vampiric Thirst.
descriptionHtml:
[heading]Spectacular Night Eye[/heading]
Have you ever thought the default Night-Eye effect was a bit dull? Me too... especially after using [url=http://oblivion.nexusmods.com/mods/7327/]this Oblivion mod[/url] for so long. So I thought I'd jump into the CK and see what could be done. Turns out, quite a lot:

[youtube]Jx5-akzMTOY[/youtube]

SNE is a selection of dramatic nighteye effects that overhaul and improve the night-eye effect. If you install BigFuzzyBear's [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16615/]Night Eye Overhaul[/url] as well, you'll be able to find rings, scrolls and potions of night-eye in the world. You won't have to rely on being either a Khajiit or a vampire to actually see in the dark.

SNE is now (v4.1+) compatible with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22274/]Predator Vision[/url] by Gopher. You can pick any two of these effects, and use them for the night vision/thermal vision abilities added in that mod.

Version 5 and up are also compatible with Msleeches' [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24222/]Vampiric Thirst[/url]. You can choose any of the effects to act as your vampiric night vision.

Seven different effects! Try them all and choose your favourite, or swap them around for a whole new look.

[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/35281-1-1391337349.jpg[/img]

Energy: A lurid, two-tone landscape of constantly shifting colours.
Psycho: As well as brightening the whole image, Psycho reverses the colours so red becomes green, blue becomes yellow and so on.
Garland: A brightened view, with severe blurring in the lower half of the screen.
Temeraire: More light, simple as. A gorgeous riot of colour
Precipice: A harsh edge-detection shader, with a slight tint to the brightest areas
Bliss: A negative image. Dark becomes light and light becomes dark.
Sideline: My take on the default effect, with less blue and more bloom.

All image manipulation is done in-game, by the Creation engine itself. Not a single line of code was written to achieve these effects; there is no performance impact whatsoever.

[heading]Installation[/heading]
Fully scripted NMM install. Manual installation instructions included in the archive. No quests, scripts or anything that might interfere with saved games.
author: OfftheRails
